intro: Scandix falcata, commonly known as the sickleleaf scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and riverbanks. Scandix falcata is also known for its historical use in traditional medicine.
